title: Detection of allele frequencies in the cDNA sample
original description: This protocol provides an useful technique for detecting allele frequencies in the cDNA sample
steps:
1. Reverse transcription of total RNA
Reverse transcript total RNA to cDNA
2. Primer design
Design the PCR primers at conserved regions between alleles, and the amplified region includes target SNP site.
3. TaqMan probe design
Design two dye-labeled (FAM and VIC) TaqMan probes for allele-specific detection.
4. Preparation of the digital PCR chip
Prepare the reaction mix (Digital PCR Master Mix (Thermo Fisher Scientific), forward and reverse primers, TaqMan probes, diluted DNA, and water) and load it onto the digital PCR chip (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
5. PCR
Perform PCR with the following cycles: (1) 96°C, 10 min (2) 39 cycles of 56 °C, 2 min and 98°C, 30 sec and (3) 56°C, 2 min.
6. Detection of allele frequencies
Count the copy number of each allele by detecting fluorescence using the QuantStudioTM 3D (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
ai_generated_description: This molecular biology protocol aims to detect allele frequencies in a cDNA sample using digital PCR and TaqMan probes. The method allows for accurate quantification of gene variants in a sample and aids in understanding genetic diversity.
